body:
# Hibari API

Work in progress API backend for extra Kitsu statistics for [Hibari](https://github.com/wopian/hibari)

Initially developed as part of the *Web Services* module at Bucks New University

## Installation

TODO: Write installation instructions here

## Usage

TODO: Write usage instructions here

```bash
bin/deps_release
KEMAL_ENV=production bin/api
```

## Development

### External Dependencies

- sqlite3 (libsqlite3-dev)

### Commands

#### Install Shards

```shell
crystal deps
```

#### Start Dev Server

```shell
crystal src/api.cr
```

#### Run Tests

```shell
crystal spec
```

#### Update Documentation

```shell
crystal docs
```

#### Build Server

```shell
crystal build src/api.cr --release
./api
```

## Contributing

1. [Fork it](https://github.com/wopian/hibari-api/fork)
2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b feat/myFeature`)
3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'feat: add my feature'`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin feat/myFeature`)
5. Create a Pull Request

## Contributors

- [wopian](https://github.com/wopian) James Harris - creator, maintainer

types.name: Array
types.doc:
An `Array` is an ordered, integer-indexed collection of objects of type T.

Array indexing starts at 0. A negative index is assumed to be
relative to the end of the array: -1 indicates the last element,
-2 is the next to last element, and so on.

An `Array` can be created using the usual `new` method (several are provided), or with an array literal:

```
Array(Int32).new  # => []
[1, 2, 3]         # Array(Int32)
[1, "hello", 'x'] # Array(Int32 | String | Char)
```

An `Array` can have mixed types, meaning T will be a union of types, but these are determined
when the array is created, either by specifying T or by using an array literal. In the latter
case, T will be set to the union of the array literal elements' types.

When creating an empty array you must always specify T:

```
[] of Int32 # same as Array(Int32)
[]          # syntax error
```

An `Array` is implemented using an internal buffer of some capacity
and is reallocated when elements are pushed to it when more capacity
is needed. This is normally known as a [dynamic array](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dynamic_array).

You can use a special array literal syntax with other types too, as long as they define an argless
`new` method and a `<<` method. `Set` is one such type:

```
set = Set{1, 2, 3} # => Set{1, 2, 3}
set.class          # => Set(Int32)
```

The above is the same as this:

```
set = Set(typeof(1, 2, 3)).new
set << 1
set << 2
set << 3
```
types.summary: An Array is an ordered, integer-indexed collection of objects of type T.

def.name: frequencies
def.body:
hash = {} of Int64 => Int64
self.each do |key|
  if hash[key]?
    __temp_123 = key
    hash[__temp_123] = hash[__temp_123] + 1_i64
  else
    hash[key] = 1_i64
  end
end
hash

def.name: mean
def.body:
if size == 0
  return nil
end
sum.to_f / size

def.name: median
def.body:
sorted = sort
count = sorted.size
half = count / 2
if count == 0
  return nil
end
(if (count % 2) == 1
  sorted[half]
else
  (sorted[half - 1] + sorted[half]) / 2.to_f
end).to_f

def.name: mode
def.body:
freq = sorted_frequencies
if freq.size == 0
else
  freq.last.first
end

def.name: relative_stddev
def.body:
if mean == nil
  return nil
end
if stddev == nil
  return nil
end
100.0 * ((stddev || 0) / (mean || 0))

def.name: stddev
def.body:
if variance == nil
  return nil
end
Math.sqrt(variance || 0)

def.name: variance
def.body:
if mean == nil
  return nil
end
v = self.reduce(0) do |acc, i|
  acc + ((i - (mean || 0)) ** 2)
end
v.to_f / size

def.name: run
def.body:
Schedule.every(:sunday, "00:00:00") do
  if TEST
  else
    Tasks::Users.cron_runner
  end
  if TEST
  else
    Tasks::LibraryEntries.cron_runner
  end
end

def.name: create_anime
def.body:
anime_id = data.id.to_i
attr = data.attributes
anime = (Repo.get(Repo::Anime, anime_id)) || Repo::Anime.new
anime.status = (AiringStatus.parse(attr.status)).value
anime.start_date = attr.startDate
anime.episodes = attr.episodeCount
anime.updated_at = attr.updatedAt
anime.created_at = attr.createdAt
if anime.id
  if DEV
    p("update anime #{anime_id}")
  end
  Repo.update(anime)
else
  if DEV
    p("insert anime #{anime_id}")
  end
  anime.id = anime_id
  Repo.insert(anime)
end

def.name: create_library_entries
def.body:
entry_id = data.id.to_i
anime_id = data.relationships.media.data.id.to_i
attr = data.attributes
entry = (Repo.get(Repo::AnimeLibraryEntry, entry_id)) || Repo::AnimeLibraryEntry.new
entry.rating = attr.ratingTwenty
entry.status = (Status.parse(attr.status)).value
entry.progress = attr.progress
entry.updated_at = attr.updatedAt
entry.created_at = attr.createdAt
entry.anime_id = anime_id
entry.user_id = user_id
if entry.id
  if DEV
    p("update entry #{entry_id}")
  end
  Repo.update(entry)
else
  if DEV
    p("insert entry #{entry_id}")
  end
  entry.id = entry_id
  Repo.insert(entry)
end

def.name: create_user
def.body:
user_id = data.id.to_i
attr = data.attributes
if user_id == -10
  return
end
user = (Repo.get(Repo::User, user_id)) || Repo::User.new
user.name = attr.name
user.updated_at = attr.updatedAt
user.created_at = attr.createdAt
if user.id
  if DEV
    p("update user #{user_id}")
  end
  Repo.update(user)
else
  if DEV
    p("insert user #{user_id}")
  end
  user.id = user_id
  Repo.insert(user)
end

def.name: cron_runner
def.body:
query = Repo::Query.select(["id"])
users = Repo.all(Repo::User, query)
users.each do |user|
  if DEV
    p("## Running for user #{user.id}")
  end
  library_entries_init(user.id)
  if DEV
    p("## Finished for user #{user.id}")
  end
end

def.name: fetch
def.body:
query = HTTP::Params.build do |p|
  p.add("filter[user_id]", user_id.to_s)
  p.add("filter[kind]", "anime")
  p.add("fields[library-entries]", "createdAt,updatedAt,status,progress,ratingTwenty,media")
  p.add("fields[anime]", "createdAt,updatedAt,status,startDate,episodeCount")
  p.add("include", "media")
  p.add("page[limit]", LIMIT_LIBRARY.to_s)
  p.add("page[offset]", offset.to_s)
end
Hibari::Kitsu.get("library-entries", query)

def.name: library_entries
def.body:
entries = Mappings.from_json(fetch(user_id.to_s, offset * LIMIT_LIBRARY))
entries.included.each do |data|
  if data.type != "anime"
  else
    Helper.create_anime(data)
  end
end
entries.data.each do |data|
  Helper.create_library_entries(data, user_id)
end
if entries.links.next
  return true
else
  return false
end

def.name: library_entries_init
def.body:
has_next_page = true
next_page = offset
while has_next_page
  has_next_page = library_entries(user_id, offset)
  if has_next_page
    if DEV
      p("# Getting next page")
    end
    offset = offset + 1
  else
    if DEV
      p("# No more pages")
    end
    break
  end
end

Included is not included if there are no relationships, so
create an empty array to avoid dealing with Nil

def.body:
json.object do
  _data = @data
  if _data.nil?
  else

  end
  _included = @included

  else
    json.field("included") do
      _included.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _links = @links
  if _links.nil?
  else
    json.field("links") do
      _links.to_json(json)
    end
  end
end

def.name: cron_runner
def.body:
0.upto(5) do |i|
  data = Mappings.from_json(fetch_users(i * LIMIT))
  data.data.each do |data|
    Helper.create_user(data)
  end
end

def.name: fetch_users
def.body:
query = HTTP::Params.build do |p|
  p.add("sort", "id")
  p.add("fields[users]", "name,updatedAt,createdAt")
  p.add("page[limit]", LIMIT.to_s)
  p.add("page[offset]", offset.to_s)
end
Hibari::Kitsu.get("users", query)

constants.name: HEADERS
constants.value: {"Content-Type" => JsonAPI::CONTENT_TYPE, "Strict-Transport-Security" => "max-age=63072000; includeSubDomains; preload", "Content-Security-Policy" => "default-src 'none'", "Cache-Control" => "public, max-age=900, s-maxage=900", "X-Frame-Options" => "SAMEORIGIN", "X-XSS-Protection" => "1; mode=block", "X-Content-Type-Options" => "nosniff", "Referrer-Policy" => "strict-origin-when-cross-origin"}
constants.doc: Response headers for the Hibari API

def.name: attribute_stats
def.body:
json.object do
  stats.each do |key, value|
    if value.is_a?(Hash)
      attribute_stats_freq(json, key, value)
    else
      if value.nil?
      else
        value = value.round(2)
      end
      JsonAPI.field(json, key, value)
    end
  end
end

def.name: attribute_stats_freq
def.body:
json.field(key) do
  json.object do
    value.each do |k, v|
      JsonAPI.field(json, k, v)
    end
  end
end

instance_methods.name: construct_data
instance_methods.summary: Creates the data array of the JSON:API response

def.name: construct_data
def.body:
json.field("data") do
  json.array do
    rs.each do
      construct_resource(json, col_names, rs)
    end
  end
end

instance_methods.name: construct_field
instance_methods.doc:
Creates the fields of JSON:API responses

Returns the following JSON structures:

```json
"key": "value"
```

```json
"key": [ "value" ]
```

def.name: construct_field
def.body:
case value
when Bytes
  json.field(col) do
    json.array do
      value.each do |e|
        json.scalar(e)
      end
    end
  end
when NotSupported
else
  json.field(col) do
    value.to_json(json)
  end
end

instance_methods.name: construct_resource
instance_methods.doc:
Creates the JSON:API resource object

Returns the following JSON structure:

```json
{
  "col_name": "value",
  ...
}
```

def.name: construct_resource
def.body:
json.object do
  col_names.each do |col|
    construct_field(json, col, rs.read)
  end
end

def.name: error
def.body: ({errors: [{title: title, detail: detail, status: status, code: status}]}).to_json

instance_methods.name: response
instance_methods.doc: Creates the JSON:API response object

def.name: response
def.body:
JSON.build do |json|
  json.object do
    construct_data(json, col_names, rs)
  end
end

def.name: get
def.body:
uri = URI.parse(BASE_URL + resource)
uri.query = params.to_s
response = HTTP::Client.get(uri, headers: HTTP::Headers {"Content-Type" => Hibari::JsonAPI::CONTENT_TYPE, "Accepts" => Hibari::JsonAPI::CONTENT_TYPE, "User-Agent" => "hibari-api/#{Hibari::VERSION}/#{Crystal::VERSION} (wopian/hibari-api)"})
response.body

def.name: from_rs
def.body:
begin
  __temp_95 = Array(self).new
  __temp_94.each do
    __temp_95 << (self.new(__temp_94))
  end
  __temp_95
ensure
  __temp_94.close
end

def.name: to_json
def.body:
json.object do
  _updated_at = @updated_at
  if _updated_at.nil?
  else
    json.field("updated_at") do
      _updated_at.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _created_at = @created_at
  if _created_at.nil?
  else
    json.field("created_at") do
      _created_at.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _status = @status
  if _status.nil?
  else
    json.field("status") do
      _status.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _episodes = @episodes
  if _episodes.nil?
  else
    json.field("episodes") do
      _episodes.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _start_date = @start_date
  if _start_date.nil?
  else
    json.field("start_date") do
      _start_date.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _id = @id
  if _id.nil?
  else
    json.field("id") do
      _id.to_json(json)
    end
  end
end

instance_methods.name: to_query_hash
instance_methods.doc: Builds a hash from all `CRECTO_FIELDS` defined

def.name: to_query_hash
def.body:
query_hash = {} of Symbol => DbValue | ArrayDbValue
if include_virtual || (@@changeset_fields.includes?(:updated_at))
  query_hash[:updated_at] = self.updated_at
  if (query_hash[:updated_at].is_a?(Time)) && (query_hash[:updated_at].as(Time)).local?
    query_hash[:updated_at] = (query_hash[:updated_at].as(Time)).to_utc
  end
end
if include_virtual || (@@changeset_fields.includes?(:created_at))
  query_hash[:created_at] = self.created_at
  if (query_hash[:created_at].is_a?(Time)) && (query_hash[:created_at].as(Time)).local?
    query_hash[:created_at] = (query_hash[:created_at].as(Time)).to_utc
  end
end
if include_virtual || (@@changeset_fields.includes?(:status))
  query_hash[:status] = self.status
  if (query_hash[:status].is_a?(Time)) && (query_hash[:status].as(Time)).local?
    query_hash[:status] = (query_hash[:status].as(Time)).to_utc
  end
end
if include_virtual || (@@changeset_fields.includes?(:episodes))
  query_hash[:episodes] = self.episodes
  if (query_hash[:episodes].is_a?(Time)) && (query_hash[:episodes].as(Time)).local?
    query_hash[:episodes] = (query_hash[:episodes].as(Time)).to_utc
  end
end
if include_virtual || (@@changeset_fields.includes?(:start_date))
  query_hash[:start_date] = self.start_date
  if (query_hash[:start_date].is_a?(Time)) && (query_hash[:start_date].as(Time)).local?
    query_hash[:start_date] = (query_hash[:start_date].as(Time)).to_utc
  end
end
if self.id.nil?
else
  query_hash[:id] = self.id
end
query_hash

def.name: update_from_hash
def.body:
hash.each do |key, value|
  case key.to_s
  when "updated_at"
    if value.to_s.empty?
      @updated_at = nil
    else
      @updated_at = value.to_s
    end
  when "created_at"
    if value.to_s.empty?
      @created_at = nil
    else
      @created_at = value.to_s
    end
  when "status"
    if value.to_s.empty?
      @status = nil
    else
      if value.to_i?
        @status = value.to_i
      end
    end
  when "episodes"
    if value.to_s.empty?
      @episodes = nil
    else
      if value.to_i?
        @episodes = value.to_i
      end
    end
  when "start_date"
    if value.to_s.empty?
      @start_date = nil
    else
      @start_date = value.to_s
    end
  end
end

def.name: to_json
def.body:
json.object do
  _updated_at = @updated_at
  if _updated_at.nil?
  else
    json.field("updated_at") do
      _updated_at.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _created_at = @created_at
  if _created_at.nil?
  else
    json.field("created_at") do
      _created_at.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _status = @status
  if _status.nil?
  else
    json.field("status") do
      _status.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _rating = @rating
  if _rating.nil?
  else
    json.field("rating") do
      _rating.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _progress = @progress
  if _progress.nil?
  else
    json.field("progress") do
      _progress.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _user_id = @user_id
  if _user_id.nil?
  else
    json.field("user_id") do
      _user_id.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _anime_id = @anime_id
  if _anime_id.nil?
  else
    json.field("anime_id") do
      _anime_id.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _id = @id
  if _id.nil?
  else
    json.field("id") do
      _id.to_json(json)
    end
  end
end

instance_methods.name: to_query_hash
instance_methods.doc: Builds a hash from all `CRECTO_FIELDS` defined

def.name: to_query_hash
def.body:
query_hash = {} of Symbol => DbValue | ArrayDbValue
if include_virtual || (@@changeset_fields.includes?(:updated_at))
  query_hash[:updated_at] = self.updated_at
  if (query_hash[:updated_at].is_a?(Time)) && (query_hash[:updated_at].as(Time)).local?
    query_hash[:updated_at] = (query_hash[:updated_at].as(Time)).to_utc
  end
end
if include_virtual || (@@changeset_fields.includes?(:created_at))
  query_hash[:created_at] = self.created_at
  if (query_hash[:created_at].is_a?(Time)) && (query_hash[:created_at].as(Time)).local?
    query_hash[:created_at] = (query_hash[:created_at].as(Time)).to_utc
  end
end
if include_virtual || (@@changeset_fields.includes?(:status))
  query_hash[:status] = self.status
  if (query_hash[:status].is_a?(Time)) && (query_hash[:status].as(Time)).local?
    query_hash[:status] = (query_hash[:status].as(Time)).to_utc
  end
end
if include_virtual || (@@changeset_fields.includes?(:rating))
  query_hash[:rating] = self.rating
  if (query_hash[:rating].is_a?(Time)) && (query_hash[:rating].as(Time)).local?
    query_hash[:rating] = (query_hash[:rating].as(Time)).to_utc
  end
end
if include_virtual || (@@changeset_fields.includes?(:progress))
  query_hash[:progress] = self.progress
  if (query_hash[:progress].is_a?(Time)) && (query_hash[:progress].as(Time)).local?
    query_hash[:progress] = (query_hash[:progress].as(Time)).to_utc
  end
end
if include_virtual || (@@changeset_fields.includes?(:user_id))
  query_hash[:user_id] = self.user_id
  if (query_hash[:user_id].is_a?(Time)) && (query_hash[:user_id].as(Time)).local?
    query_hash[:user_id] = (query_hash[:user_id].as(Time)).to_utc
  end
end
if include_virtual || (@@changeset_fields.includes?(:anime_id))
  query_hash[:anime_id] = self.anime_id
  if (query_hash[:anime_id].is_a?(Time)) && (query_hash[:anime_id].as(Time)).local?
    query_hash[:anime_id] = (query_hash[:anime_id].as(Time)).to_utc
  end
end
if self.id.nil?
else
  query_hash[:id] = self.id
end
query_hash

def.name: update_from_hash
def.body:
hash.each do |key, value|
  case key.to_s
  when "updated_at"
    if value.to_s.empty?
      @updated_at = nil
    else
      @updated_at = value.to_s
    end
  when "created_at"
    if value.to_s.empty?
      @created_at = nil
    else
      @created_at = value.to_s
    end
  when "status"
    if value.to_s.empty?
      @status = nil
    else
      if value.to_i?
        @status = value.to_i
      end
    end
  when "rating"
    if value.to_s.empty?
      @rating = nil
    else
      if value.to_i?
        @rating = value.to_i
      end
    end
  when "progress"
    if value.to_s.empty?
      @progress = nil
    else
      if value.to_i?
        @progress = value.to_i
      end
    end
  when "user_id"
    if value.to_s.empty?
      @user_id = nil
    else
      if value.to_i?
        @user_id = value.to_i
      end
    end
  when "anime_id"
    if value.to_s.empty?
      @anime_id = nil
    else
      if value.to_i?
        @anime_id = value.to_i
      end
    end
  end
end

def.name: anime_stats
def.body:
query = (Repo::Query.select(["rating"])).where(anime_id: anime_id).where("rating IS NOT NULL")
entries = (Repo.all(Repo::AnimeLibraryEntry, query)).map do |entry|
  entry.rating!
end
stats = {"total" => entries.size, "mean" => entries.mean, "median" => entries.median, "mode" => entries.mode, "variance" => entries.variance, "stddev" => entries.stddev, "relative_stddev" => entries.relative_stddev, "rating_frequencies" => entries.frequencies}

def.name: user_stats
def.body:
query = (Repo::Query.select(["rating"])).where(user_id: user_id).where("rating IS NOT NULL")
entries = (Repo.all(Repo::AnimeLibraryEntry, query)).map do |entry|
  entry.rating!
end
stats = {"total" => entries.size, "mean" => entries.mean, "median" => entries.median, "mode" => entries.mode, "variance" => entries.variance, "stddev" => entries.stddev, "relative_stddev" => entries.relative_stddev, "rating_frequencies" => entries.frequencies}
